page.title: 15 MR.H.LEATHLEY
page.content: The Leathley family have been connected with Masham for many years. Victoria and Sara Jayne went to interview Mr.H.Leathley who lives up Gun Bank.He was born in 1928 and went to Masham School. He was asked if he remembered his school days.He said he remembered doing the usual things like playing football and cricket.Maths was his favourite subject.He did lots of adding and subtracting.He said that first thing in the morning after prayers was music."The Schoolmaster was crazy-mad about music.I believe he was the choir master at the church." What did he think of Masham today? Had it changed a lot? "Not really,it hasn't changed a great deal,except for the Post Office.It used to be the Chapel and the Post Office was a wooden hut."
